dialogue.text: I decide to invite Makoto over and tap on her name in my phone.
Being that last time didn’t exactly go {i}well{/i}, I figure that I might need to do something about Ami if I want tonight to end in success.
But I need to at least figure out if Makoto is able to get out of work first.
Hello? Sensei?
Hey. You wouldn’t happen to be free right now, would you?
Umm...I {i}could{/i} be free, I suppose. My mom and I are both in the shop right now.
Does she know that I'm the one calling you?
No. She’s in the back room at the moment. She probably didn't even hear my phone ring.
Cool. Tell her you need to study again or something.
Just to clarify, you {i}are{/i} inviting me over...Correct?
Correct.
Is your demon-spawn of a [niece] there right now?
She isn’t a demon-spawn...but probably. I’ll figure out a way to deal with her, though.
Good. Because I’d very much like to actually be {i}alone{/i} with you if we’re going to be in your house.
Are you trying to seduce me over the phone?
N-No! I just...you know! It’s {i}your{/i} house!
I’m obviously going to...expect certain things if you invite me over.
What are you expecting, Makoto?
Makoto hangs up the phone without responding to my question, which I’m assuming means that she is, in fact, going to come over.
I begin my trip home right away and type out a convincing text message to Ami about how I need her to go grocery shopping.
Being as dedicated to pleasing me as she is, I know that she’ll do virtually anything I ask.
Which is precisely why I come up with a list of imaginary ingredients for her to procure in order to extend the time Makoto and I will be together for.
I truly am a genius when I want to be.
Excuse me...
Hey. How was your walk over?
It would be a lot nicer if you were a normal adult and had a car to pick me up in.
If I had a car to pick you up in, there wouldn’t be much of a reason for us to come {i}here{/i} in the first place.
I’m not sure what you mean by that, Sensei. Please clarify.
If I had a car, I would never let anything come between you and me and the act of hugging.
Uhh...I knew that’s what you were insinuating, but I thought you were at least going to be a little less...direct about it.
No point. You’re smart enough to know that I wouldn’t get Ami out of here unless there was something I wanted from you.
{i}From{/i} me? Or {i}with{/i} me?
Whichever. It doesn’t really matter to me.
Come on! At least be nice when you’re trying to hook up with me!
Woah, chill. I just want to hug.
Aren’t you my classroom assistant or whatever? Do I really need consent from you?
Obviously. The student handbook says nothing about how classroom assistants are to hug their teachers.
If it doesn’t specifically say anything about that, doesn’t it mean it’s allowed to a certain extent?
Well, there is something in the generic section prohibiting physical relationships between teachers and students, so I’m pretty sure this would just fall under that.
You’re such a buzzkill, Makoto.
Of course I am. That’s my job.
If I don’t keep you in-line, who else will?
And don’t say Ami because she doesn’t count as an actual human being.
I think you two really need to resolve your differences.
It’s not our differences that make us adversaries- it’s our similarities.
She can sense how the relationship you and I have is special, and that makes her worried given that she has a different type of special relationship with you.
Obviously, the one you two have is more of a...business relationship while the one you and I have is more...
Huggy?
Sure. Huggy.
Bring it in, Makoto.
Thanks. This will make me feel less bad about not being able to see my dad anymore.
A hug happens and Makoto cries a little.
I console her because I am a little nicer in this version of the game.
{i}Makoto’s lust has increased to [makoto_lust]!{/i}
{i}You can now choose between affection and hugging when inviting her over!{/i}
